description.p: The subject of the present invention is an improved folding awning, of the type including the features mentioned in the preamble of the main claim.

Folding awnings are distinguished from those termed roll-up awnings in that, in the gathered position, that is, when the awning is in the non-operative position, the sheet of the awning is folded in pleats, suspended between adjacent cross-members, which are movable along a plurality of guides in order to bring the sheet from the gathered position to an extended operative position.
The present invention is particularly, although not exclusively, suitable for folding awnings provided with horizontal or approximately horizontal guides.
For such awnings with approximately horizontal guides there is in particular the problem of drainage of the water from the upper surface of the sheet.

In known embodiments, one of which is shown in Figure 1, one solution to the problem provides for the use of a sheet which, in the extended position, is taut in the region of one lateral edge thereof, parallel to the guides, and slack in the region of the opposite lateral edge. In this way, at the slack edge, the sheet, having a length greater than the distance between the cross-members, is disposed so as to form a drainage channel extending between said cross-members and inclined from the taut edge towards the slack edge.
The main drawback of such a solution lies in the fact that in the region of the slack lateral edge the sheet is subject to the action of the wind also in the extended position.
In particular, when the wind is strong, the drainage channel could be significantly deformed, so as to prejudice its drainage capacity.

Patent US 2004/003536 corresponding to the preamble of claim 1 discloses a known awning that comprises a plurality of sheets anchored at their edges to respective cross-members, which are movable along respective opposite guides in order to extend and retract the sheets.

In particular, each sheet is provided with a pipe that is positioned longitudinally along the centre line of the relative sheet, in order to keep the sheet taut downward in consequence of the weight of the same pipe.
The main drawback of this known awning lies in the fact that the sheets are subject to flutter widely due to the action of wind, because the wind can easily move transversely the pipe of each sheet.
Also, each sheet takes all the weight of the relative pipe, and so it is easily subject to deformations and breaking.

The principal problem of the present invention is that of providing an awning of the aforesaid type structurally and functionally designed in such a way as to make it possible to remedy the drawbacks mentioned with reference to the prior art cited.
This problem is solved by the invention with an awning produced in accordance with the following claims.

In Figures 2 to 6, the reference 1 indicates as a whole an awning of the folding type with a support structure 1a formed by a pair of longitudinal members 2, each of which is supported by a pair of pillars 3, which bear on an area of ground S, holding up the awning 1.

The awning 1 protects the area of ground S from the rays of the sun and from rainwater. The longitudinal members 2 are substantially parallel to the area of ground S. On the lower face of the longitudinal members 2 there is fitted or provided a respective guide 4. Supported between the guides 4 are cross-members 5, the first and the last of which, indicated respectively by 5a and 5b, respectively define a rear face and a front face of the awning 1.

The cross-member 5a is fixed, while the cross-members 5, 5b are movable along the guides 4 between a first, gathered, position (Figure 2) and a second, extended, position (Figure 3). The awning 1, in general, may also be used in a semi-extended intermediate position, comprised between the first and the second position.

Secured to the cross-members 5, 5a, 5b is a sheet 6 delimited by a rear face edge 7a in the region of the cross-member 5a, a front edge 7b in the region of the cross-member 5b, and two lateral edges 8 in the region of the guides 4.

The sheet 6 is divided into portions (five portions 10a,b,c,d,e in the exemplary embodiment of Figures 2 and 3), each of which extends between a pair of consecutive cross-members and is secured to the latter.

Each of the portions 10a,b,c,d,e comprises two drainage sections 11a,b, extending respectively from a central region of the sheet 6 to each of the lateral edges 8. In each drainage section 11a,b, the length of the sheet 6 in a plane XY transverse to the cross-members 5, 5a, 5b (plane of Figure 3) is greater than the distance between two consecutive cross-members 5,5a,5b, so as to form a drainage channel 12 between each pair of consecutive cross-members 5, 5a, 5b.

The drainage channel 12 is bounded by two folds 13a,b of each portion 10a,b,c,d,e of the sheet 6, which are joined to each other by means of stitching, or by adhesive means, or by thermowelding in the region of a bottom line 16 of the drainage channel 12. The bottom line 16 is curved, with the concavity facing towards the area of ground S, and comprises two ends 14 in the region of the lateral edges 8 and a high point 15, in a central area of the sheet 6, which separates the two drainage sections 11a,b from each other.

Each portion 10a,b,c,d,e of the sheet 6, in the region of the bottom line 16, comprises a slot 17 extending along said drainage channel 12 from one of the lateral edges 8 to the other. Each portion 10a,b,c,d,e of the sheet 6 comprises a rod-like elongate stiffening element 18 for the bottom line 16, inserted into the slot 17.

According to an alternative embodiment of the invention, the sheet 6 comprises a single drainage section, with a drainage channel inclined from one of the lateral edges to the other, in a similar manner to the known awning 100 of Figure 1. In the latter case the bottom of the drainage channel is rectilinear.

The awning 1 comprises tensioning means 20 secured to the sheet 6 at at least one securing point 21 in the region of the drainage channel 12 so as to place the sheet 6 under tension when it is in the second, extended position or, according to an alternative embodiment of the invention, when it is any position between the semi-extended position and the extended position.

The tensioning means 20 are located in the region of both the lateral edges 8, as shown in the appended drawings, or in the region of only one of the lateral edges, as in the version similar to that of the awning 100 of Figure 1. Alternatively, in an alternative version which is not shown, the tensioning means 21 may be located in an intermediate position between the lateral edges 8.

The tensioning means 20 comprise a kinematic mechanism 22, located in the region of the lateral edge 8, movable in the plane XY, and secured to both of a pair of consecutive cross-members 5, 5a, 5b. The kinematic mechanism 22 is of the quadrilateral type comprising a pair of cranks 23, each of which is hinged at one of its ends 23a to a respective cross-member of a pair of consecutive cross-members 5, 5a, 5b and a connecting rod 24 secured to the cranks 23 by means of a pair of respective hinges 25. Each of the portions 10a,b,c,d,e of the sheet 6 is secured to the connecting rod 24 at the securing point 21, located on the elongate element 18, in the region of one end of the bottom line 16 of the drainage channel 12.
Between the securing point 21 and the connecting rod 24 a resilient element, formed by the spring 26, is interposed.
In the gathered position (Figure 5) the spring 26 is slackened, while in the extended and/or intermediate position the spring 26 is tensioned.

According to other alternative embodiments of the invention, as an alternative to the presence of the spring 26, the kinematic mechanism 22 comprises a resiliently deformable element. Between the resiliently deformable elements it is possible to use a telescopic crank 23 with springing between the two mutually slidable parts, or a crank divided into two parts which are connected to each other by means of a resilient hinge.

According to other alternative embodiments, as an alternative to the use of resilient elements, the securing point 21 is connected directly to the connecting rod 24 (portions 10d,e of the sheet 6 in Figure 2) and the sheet 6 is made of elastic fabric.

When passing from the gathered position to the extended position, the sheet 6 is tensioned as a result of the connection between the securing point 21 and the tensioning means 20. Any excess tension on the sheet which could lead to its breakage are avoided as a result of the presence of the spring 26 or of another resiliently deformable element of the tensioning means 20 or of the use of an elastic sheet.

The invention thus solves the problem of ensuring the correct tensioning of the sheet and in particular of the drainage channel in all operating conditions. The tensioning ensures the substantial indeformability of the sheet with respect to the action of the wind, with a consequent improvement in the efficiency of the drainage.
The aesthetic appearance of the sheet is also improved.

claim.claim-text:
Faltmarkise (1), die mindestens ein Paar Querstreben (5a, 5b) umfasst, wobei mindestens eine der genannten Querstreben (5b) entlang mindestens eines Schienenpaars (4) zwischen einer ersten zusammengefalteten Position und einer zweiten ausgefahrenen Position bewegt werden kann und mindestens eine Stoffbahn (6) zwischen dem genannten Querstrebenpaar gespannt und an diesen befestigt ist, wobei die genannte Stoffbahn einen Ablaufabschnitt (11a, 11b) umfasst, bei dem die Länge der genannten Stoffbahn (6) in einer Ebene (XY), die im Verhältnis zum genannten Querstrebenpaar (5a, 5b) quer verläuft, größer ist als der Abstand zwischen den genannten Querstreben (5a, 5b), um so einen Ablaufkanal (12) zwischen den genannten Querstreben zu bilden; wobei die genannte Faltmarkise (1) außerdem Spannvorrichtungen (20) umfasst, die an der genannten Stoffbahn (6) an mindestens einem Befestigungspunkt (21) auf dem genannten Ablaufkanal (12) befestigt sind, um die genannte Stoffbahn (6) mindestens in die genannte gespannte zweite Position zu bringen;
wobei die genannte Faltmarkise (1) dadurch gekennzeichnet ist, dass die genannten Spannvorrichtungen (20) eine Mechanik (22) umfassen, die an der einen oder der anderen der genannten Querstreben (5a, 5b) befestigt und in der genannten Querebene (XY) beweglich ist.
Faltmarkise (1) nach Anspruch 1, bei der der genannte mindestens eine Befestigungspunkt (21) sich auf einem Ende (14) einer Grundlinie (16) des genannten Ablaufkanals (12) befindet.

Faltmarkise (1) nach Anspruch 1 oder 2, bei der die genannte Mechanik (22) des Typs mit Viereck ist und ein Kurbelpaar (23) umfasst, bei dem jede Kurbel an ihrem Ende (23a) an einer entsprechenden Querstrebe des genannten Querstrebenpaars (5a, 5b) mit Scharnieren befestigt ist, und eine Pleuelstange (24), die an den genannten Kurbeln (23) mit einem Paar entsprechender Scharniere (25) angebracht ist, wobei die genannte Stoffbahn (6) an der genannten Pleuelstange (24) an mindestens einem Befestigungspunkt (21) angebracht ist.
Faltmarkise (1) nach Anspruch 3, bei der zwischen dem genannten Befestigungspunkt (21) und der genannten Pleuelstange (24) ein elastisches Element (26) eingefügt ist.
Faltmarkise (1) nach Anspruch 1, bei der die genannte Mechanik (22) ein elastisch verformbares Element umfasst.

Faltmarkise (1) nach einem oder mehreren der vorangegangenen Ansprüche, bei der die genannte Stoffbahn (6) Ösen (17) entlang des genannten Ablaufkanals (12) umfasst, wobei in diese Ösen (17) ein längliches, stabförmiges Versteifungselement (18) eingesetzt ist.
Faltmarkise (1) nach einem oder mehreren der vorgenannten Ansprüche, bei der die genannte Stoffbahn (6) aus elastischem Gewebe besteht.

Folding awning (1) comprising at least one pair of cross-members (5a, 5b), at least one of said cross-members (5b) being movable along at least one pair of guides (4) between a first, gathered, position and a second, extended, position, and at least one sheet (6) extending between said pair of cross-members and secured thereto, said sheet comprising at least a drainage section (11a,b) in which the length of said sheet (6) in a plane (XY) transverse to said pair of cross-members (5a, 5b) is greater than the distance between said cross-members (5a, 5b) so as to form a drainage channel (12) between said cross-members; said folding awning (1) comprising, also, tensioning means (20) secured to said sheet (6) at at least one securing point (21) in the region of said drainage channel (12) so as to place said sheet (6) under tension in at least said second, extended, position;
said folding awning (1) being characterized in that said tensioning means (20) comprise a kinematic mechanism (22) secured to both said cross-members (5a, 5b) and movable in said transverse plane (XY).
Folding awning (1) according to claim 1, wherein said at least one securing point (21) is located in the region of an end (14) of a bottom line (16) of said drainage channel (12).

Folding awning (1) according to claim 1 or 2, wherein said kinematic mechanism (22) is of the quadrilateral type comprising a pair of cranks (23) each of which is hinged at one of its ends (23a) to a respective cross-member of said pair of cross-members (5a, 5b) and a connecting rod (24) secured to said cranks (23) by means of a pair of respective hinges (25), said sheet (6) being secured to said connecting rod (24) at said at least one securing point (21).
Folding awning (1) according to claim 3, wherein a resilient element (26) is interposed between said securing point (21) and said connecting rod (24).
Folding awning (1) according to claim 1, wherein said kinematic mechanism (22) comprises a resiliently deformable element.

Folding awning (1) according to one or more of the preceding claims, wherein said sheet (6) comprises a slot (17) extending along said drainage channel (12), a rod-like elongate stiffening element (18) being inserted into said slot (17).
Folding awning (1) according to one or more of the preceding claims, wherein said sheet (6) is made of elastic fabric.

Auvent pliant (1) comprenant au moins une paire de traverses (5a, 5b), au moins une desdites traverses (5b) étant mobile le long d'au moins une paire de glissières (4) entre une première position repliée et une seconde position étendue et au moins une toile (6) étendue entre ladite paire de traverses et assujettie à ces dernières, ladite toile comprenant une partie pour l'écoulement (11a, 11b) dans laquelle la longueur de ladite toile (6) sur un plan (XY) transversal par rapport à ladite paire de traverses (5a, 5b) est supérieure à la distance entre lesdites traverses (5a, 5b) de façon à former une rigole d'écoulement (12) entre lesdites traverses ; ledit auvent pliant (1) comprenant, en outre, des moyens de tensionnement (20) assujettis à ladite toile (6) sur au moins un point de liaison (21) au niveau de ladite rigole d'écoulement (12) de sorte à mettre en tension ladite toile (6) sur au moins ladite seconde position étendue ;
ledit auvent pliant (1) étant caractérisé en ce que lesdits moyens de tensionnement (20) comprennent un système cinématique (22) assujetti à l'une ou à l'autre desdites traverses (5a, 5b) et mobile sur ledit plan (XY) transversal.
Auvent pliant (1) selon la revendication 1, dans lequel au moins un point de liaison (21) est situé au niveau d'une extrémité (14) d'une ligne de fond (16) de ladite rigole d'écoulement (12).

Auvent pliant (1) selon la revendication 1 ou 2, dans lequel ledit système cinématique (22) est de type à quadrilatère comprenant une paire de manivelles (23) chacune desquelles est articulée sur une de ses extrémités (23a) sur une traverse respective de ladite paire de traverses (5a, 5b) et une bielle (24) assujettie auxdites manivelles (23) moyennant une paire d'articulations respectives (25), ladite toile (6) étant assujettie à ladite bielle (24) sur ledit au moins un point de liaison (21).
Auvent pliant (1) selon la revendication 3, dans lequel entre ledit point de liaison (21) et ladite bielle (24) est interposé un élément élastique (26).
Auvent pliant (1) selon la revendication 1, dans lequel ledit système cinématique (22) comprend un élément déformable élastiquement.

Auvent pliant (1) selon une ou plusieurs des revendications précédentes, dans lequel ladite toile (6) comprend un oeillet (17) étendu le long de ladite rigole d'écoulement (12), dans ledit oeillet (17) étant inséré un élément allongé en forme de tige de raidissement (18).
Auvent pliant (1) selon une ou plusieurs des revendications précédentes, dans lequel ladite toile (6) est en tissu élastique.
